abstract: Keith Oleszkowicz and Jessica Shapiro, patients who had bariatric surgery at nearly same time, both experienced significant weight loss but also disappointment that procedure did not bring about as much life change as expected; operation has become increasingly common in United States with rising obesity (Series: The Science of Fat).
lead_paragraph: Even as the pounds fell away and their health improved, two patients contended with the feeling that life hadn’t changed as much as they’d hoped.
snippet: Even as the pounds fell away and their health improved, two patients contended with the feeling that life hadn’t changed as much as they’d hoped....

headline.main: After Weight-Loss Surgery, a Year of Joys and Disappointments
headline.print_headline: A Year of Losses and Gains
